intro: Talipariti borneense, commonly known as the Bornean talipariti, is a tropical shrub native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species, often found in secondary growth areas.
